TRAINING SPECIALIST - CONSTRUCTION EQUIPMENT

Experienced Construction Equipment Operator and Carpenter that is hardworking, dependable, and reliable; offering extensive experience with heavy equipment operation.
Highly motivated to produce quality work on tight deadlines with safety in mind and to exceed expectations.

Combat Engineer: Construction Foreman, E-7
Serve as Platoon Sergeant of a 42 Marine size platoon that is responsible for the professional development, morale, health and welfare of Marines.
Mentor Marines on the knowledge and procedures for: horizontal and vertical construction, blueprint reading, concrete form construction, concrete mixing and pouring, concrete saw operations, masonry work, concrete block and brick laying techniques, 250/260 CFM compressor operation and maintenance procedures, basic surveying techniques, soils testing, airfield damage repair, bridging operations, and security operations.
Create bill of materials, drawings, and submitted supporting documentation required for construction projects as necessary.
Maintained accountability for over 1.2 million dollars in tools and equipment.

(3) Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medals Iraq Campaign Medal with Bronze Star Global War on Terrorism Service Medal (4) Selected Marine Corps Reserve Medals National Defense Medal Armed Force Reserve Medal with Bronze Hour Glass and "M" Devices (3) Certificate of Commendations

Certifications: Program Management Level I, Life Cycle Logistics level I & II, AutoCad, Microsoft Office Suite, Troxler Nuclear Guage Densometer, Radiation Safety Officer, Radioactive Commodity Identification/Transportation, Hazmat, and CPR.

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Member of Eastern Constructors Organization Supervised and constructed 16 homes from start to finish for the Southwest Indian Foundation, in Gallup New Mexico.
Supervised and managed 172 construction projects throughout the Al Anbar Providence of Al Asad Iraq.
Project Manager and Construction Foreman for constructing the Marine Corps Logistics Command site aboard Al Asad Air Base, Iraq.
This became the focal point of the Marine Corps exit strategy for leaving Iraq.
Completed Combat Out Post Baghdadi project four days ahead of schedule, which effectively improved the defensive capabilities of the 7th Division Military Transition Team.
Trained 203 Soldiers on how to operate construction equipment.
Trained 432 Marines on proper construction procedures and techniques.
Developed the Radiation Safety Officer Course for the Troxler Nuclear Guage Densometer in accordance with the Nuclear Regulatory Commission guidelines, a 492 page training support package.

<JD_START>
Job Title: BIM Coordinator

Location: Newark, DE

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Country: United States

Position Location: New York, NY / Iselin, NJ / Newark, DE / Boston, M

Contract Type: Regular (US only)

Work Pattern: Full Time

Sector: Built environment

Discipline: Building services

Job Ref: 1971

Recruiter Contact: Sofiya Bula

Here at Mott MacDonald, we are experts in engineering, management, and development services supporting multisector project work in over 150 countries. One of the largest employee-owned companies in the world, we pride ourselves in our ability to deliver exceptional outcomes through the connected thinking of our 16,000+ talented consultants. Sustainability and innovation are at the heart of all of our sectors which, in North America include Advisory, Built Environment, Energy, Transportation, and Water.

Structure and MEP disciplines to join our New York office, working closely with our multidisciplinary engineers and consultant teams. As a BIM Coordinator working across all disciplines, you will lead the coordination and be responsible for the implementation of project BIM execution plans, and digital workflows for collaboration and data exchange. You will need to be fluent in the development and coordination of 3D models using Autodesk and/or Bentley software applications in major infrastructure and building projects.

Responsibilities: 

Production of models and drawings using Autodesk Revit, Civil3D, Bentley Open Suite software a plusAssist the BIM Manager in model management.Coordinate all design matters between the key project stakeholders.Coordinate services across multiple disciplines and compile into a relevant report.Assist in the development and implementation of BIM execution plansSet up, configure, and manage the project BIM platformsSupport BIM implementation, authoring, and coordination in all phases of a projectLead model federation and design resolution activities, including assisting in model navigation and leading the team during model-based design review meetingsUse Autodesk Construction Cloud, Model Coordination as a coordination tool.Communicate complex technical concepts in 3D digital modelsInterpret design intent sketches provided by the project engineersComply with company and project-specific modelling and drawing standardsGuide and mentor the BIM Modelers and identify the training requirements.Able to lead and manage the pool of BIM Modelers

Candidate Specification

Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team5+ years of local industry experience in M&E BIM implementationProficient in the use of Autodesk Revit, Civil3D, Navisworks and Bentley Open Suite software a plus.Knowledge ISO19650 a plus.Strong understanding of developing, supporting, and managing models as per project standardsDiploma or bachelor’s degree in an engineering-related disciplineThe following experience is preferredExperience with data management systems (e.g., Autodesk Construction Cloud, Bentley ProjectWise, and Microsoft SharePoint)Experience in programming software/parametric tools (e.g., Dynamo, Grasshopper, Python)

Salary Range: $90,000-$100,000

Benefits: 401k, medical, dental, and vision insurance, STD/LTD disability, holiday, PTO, parental leave, and company-paid life insurance.

Equality, diversity and inclusion

We put equality, diversity, and inclusion at the heart of our business, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all. We encourage individual expression in our workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels they have the opportunity to contribute.

Equal employment opportunity is the law.

Englishversion

Spanishversion

Chineseversion

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status or disability status.

Hybrid working policy

At Mott MacDonald, we believe it makes business sense for you and your manager to choose how you can work most effectively to meet your client, team, and personal commitments. We offer a hybrid working policy that embraces your well-being, flexibility, and trust.

More About Mott MacDonald

We’re a global engineering, management and development consultancy.

Our purpose is to improve society by considering social outcomes in everything we do, relentlessly focusing on excellence and digital innovation, transforming our clients’ businesses, our communities and employee opportunities.

A fundamental part of this is respecting each person’s differences and striving to meet their needs.

Our values: progress, respect, integrity, drive, excellence

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
